thread.title: Airbnb's new campaign branded 'creepy' by Twitter users
thread.title_full: Airbnb's new campaign branded 'creepy' by Twitter users

title: Airbnb's new campaign branded 'creepy' by Twitter users
text:
Airbnb's new campaign branded 'creepy' by Twitter users Last updated 13:51, July 17 2015 
Airbnb sent out a series of tweets as a part of a new campaign. It wasn't long before social media began to mock the company for their 'creepy' messages. 
Airbnb, the room-letting service, launched a new global ad campaign that is well-intentioned enough but has been labelled "creepy" by Twitter users. 
"Is Mankind?" aims to explore the kindness of man. The idea is that Airbnb is built on the kindness of the Airbnb community â€” people are opening up their homes to strangers, after all. The campaign launches with a film of a baby. Babies are innocent and innately kind, Airbnb says. 
The marketing push also includes billboards "in provocative locations that may either highlight the kindness of man or call it into question," and some digital and social media ads. But it was the social media element of the campaign that appears to have immediately weirded people out. Airbnb tweeted out this string of messages that ended up freaking people out: Go look through their windows, so you can understand their views.
